title: Meet the retired oil exec plugging forgotten wells to reduce emissions

multiple-choice.question: What is an orphan well, and why is it a problem?

options.label: A
options.text: An orphan well is a well that has been properly sealed and is no longer in use, but still poses an environmental risk.

options.label: B
options.text: An orphan well is a well that has no owner and was never properly sealed, pumping out environmental toxins unchecked.

options.label: C
options.text: An orphan well is a well that has been abandoned due to a lack of funding, but is still safe for the environment.

options.label: D
options.text: An orphan well is a well that has been sealed but still leaks methane gas.
